alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 4:19PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Haskell County through 445 PM CST... At 419 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sagerton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Rule, Lake Stamford Marina, Paint Creek, Sagerton and Us-380 Near The Haskell-Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
